entry.title: Remembering the Roseburg Blast: August 7, 1959
entry.summary: 66 years ago today, the Roseburg Blast devastated downtown Roseburg, Oregon. The 1959 explosion destroyed city blocks, claimed lives, and forever changed the community, leaving a legacy of resilience and remembrance that endures each August 7th.

entry.title: Bicyclist Killed in Early Morning Collision on I-5 Near Sutherlin
entry.summary: A California man was killed early Thursday when his bicycle was struck by a pickup on I-5 near Sutherlin. The crash closed the highway for about four hours. The driver had minor injuries, while a passenger was hospitalized with minor injuries, according to Oregon State Police.

entry.title: FIRE DANGER MOVES TO EXTREME STARTING SUNDAY IN DOUGLAS DISTRICT
entry.summary: August 6, 2025 3:00 p.m. The Douglas Forest Protective Association is moving the Public Use Restriction Level to Extreme, effective Sunday. This is for all private, county, state and Bureau of Indian Affairs land within the Douglas District. DFPA Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said the Industrial Fire Precaution Level will remain at Level...

entry.title: Bicyclist struck and killed by vehicle in Douglas County crash
entry.summary: A 42-year-old California man died early Thursday morning after being struck by a vehicle on his bicycle on Interstate 5 near Sutherlin, according to the Oregon State Police.

entry.title: Fire Danger Raised to Extreme Across Douglas District: Public Restrictions Increase
entry.summary: The Douglas Forest Protective Association has raised the fire danger to EXTREME across the Douglas District, effective August 10. New restrictions ban activities like using power saws, mowing dry grass, and metal work on private property until further notice.

entry.title: Gov. Kotek declares drought in Douglas, other counties
entry.summary: Gov. Tina Kotek declared a drought in Douglas, Morrow and Union counties as of Aug. 4, and directed state agencies to coordinate and prioritize assistance to the region. The declaration can be found at Executive Order 25-18.

entry.title: Roseburg children learn their power in keeping the planet
entry.summary: Museum of Natural and Cultural History Outreach Educator Kali Bissanti began her presentation Tuesday in Roseburg by asking children gathered if they could live on other planets besides the earth.

entry.title: Idleyld Park river rescues: one life saved, one lost in swift currents
entry.summary: Emergency crews responded to two river rescues along the North Umpqua Saturday. A Myrtle Creek woman was rescued after being swept downstream, while a separate incident near milepost 24.5 resulted in the drowning death of 50-year-old Jonathon Vasquez of Mapleton.

entry.title: Oregon Heritage Commission offers grants
entry.summary: OREGON — The Oregon Heritage Commission offers grants for qualified projects for the conservation, development and interpretation of Oregon's cultural heritage. Awards typically range between $3,000 and $20,000, and the grant application deadline is Oct. 2.

entry.title: Umpqua Public Transit District Suspends All Weekend Service Amid Funding Crisis
entry.summary: Umpqua Public Transit District is suspending all weekend bus service starting August 9th due to a statewide funding freeze and federal delays. More cuts may follow as the agency works to save $200,000 and maintain weekday service.
